experience: You and Cheryl both know Bernard Ong, Roger Lay, and 29 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017
Another tremendous day! Led two Strengths classes today to two different groups of 10 and 60 people.
Got this feedback in my email afterwards.

"This is by far the best and most impactful training of its kind I have had the opportunity to attend.  I also think your training style, delivery, stories, and analogies enhanced the concepts and fun".
Such an awesome feeling from helping people get this!
Awesome day today participating in Schwab's Pro Bono Challenge. We are supporting  Arizona Foundation for Women today!  Emily M. Alison Gabel Jason Kurtti Ellen Lord Felice Appell, APR Mesha Davis

•	Lead a distributed workforce of 5 Senior Managers and over 35 professionals across 4 centers•	Contact Center Strategy & Management for 4,000+ employees across 7 contact center locations•	Resource planning and strategy for multiple Schwab business lines•	Reporting and Analysis focused on driving business outcomes and improvements•	Creation of collaborative and engaging culture focused on strengths of individuals•	Inspire the teams to challenge the status quo and embrace change•	Transformational change and thought leader•	Long term strategy planning and analysis•	Real-time intraday contact routing and strategy

• Drive the development, implementation and continuous improvement of the IT Demand Management Process.• Selected, negotiated, customized and implemented large scale Genesys telephony uplift project across distributed contact center enterprise, 1000+ agents. • Select and manage external partners and vendors engaged to provide project support and services.• Engaged in all IT Compliance functions and requirements; IT SOX and PCI Compliance. • Lead cross functional teams in a matrix environment. • Facilitate discussions and selection for contact center tools and necessary infrastructure support. • Evaluate and persuade investment on tools based on cost benefit analysis and tradeoffs.

•  Responsible for operations excellence across the enterprise.•  Key focus areas include workforce management, Lean Six Sigma analysis, and capabilities   deployment.•  Process redesign and improvement for maximum P&L impact.  •  Focused on improving the customer experience and rallying the team to engage in improvement activities. •  Additional focus on infrastructure integration, call driver analysis, and the delivery of world class    customer interactions.

•	Managed a global team of industrial engineers and project managers tasked with identifying opportunities to reengineer processes and provide defect elimination resulting in $59MM+ in expense reductions.•	Responsible for reengineering target goal across 6 locations.•	Partnered on technology and telecom projects to better improve the experience for inbound customer service.•	Identified key opportunities based on size and scope to reduce waste and inefficiencies for customer service worldwide.•	Optimized call routing, capabilities, and global footprint of contact center operations•	Analyzed statistical data for proof of concept for project implementations.  Formed cost benefit analyses to prioritize resources and projects.

recommendations: Joseph  P. Babcock
Global Business Development | Sales Management | Cross Cultural negotiation  |  Program management |  Writer and speaker
March 24, 2010, Joseph  P. was Cheryl’s mentor

It is clear to see why Cheryl is so well respected by her organization, colleagues and cohorts.  As a leader at American Express, Cheryl has progressed steadily upward through the organization due to her professional leadership style and through the strength of her engaging personality.  Cheryl impresses as a leader by the complex multi-faceted approach she employs to managing a very large and mission critical department within American Express.  She is recognized as being results oriented, analytical, data driven and engaging in her management style.  Always ready and able to take on the most critical projects within an organization, she leads as an innovative process engineer, organizational designer, problem solver and focused advocate for both customer and organizational interests.  I have been impressed by the consistency of Cheryl’s performance and how she leads effectively, even under significant pressure, with skill, humility and grace.  I consider myself lucky to know Cheryl and recommend her whole-heartedly to anyone seeking to know a talented, high-performance leader and quality human being.
Joseph  P. Babcock

June 17, 2014, Cheryl managed Ameet directly

Ameet is a very accomplished manager and a fantastic leader.  I had the opportunity to work with Ameet for many years at American Express and watched him take on differing roles - each role more expansive than the last.  He has a passion for leading people, is very analytical and has a great approach to problem solving.  When Ameet reported to me, he was a fantastic partner and one that could be relied on without hesitation.  Ameet encompasses all the skills and passion necessary to be successful in both a leadership or analytical capacity.  I wholeheartedly recommend Ameet to any organization who is looking for an innovative thought leader to help shape the future of their business.

summary: Motivated, high performing professional with extensive operational and financial experience.  Proven ability to drive results, provide strategic direction, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Skilled at identifying cost savings through the reengineering of processes.  Solid background in customer service contact center operations.  Transformational change leader.  Specialties: Call volume analysis, long and short term resource planning, operational finance, people leadership, strategic planning, managing change, enterprise system deployments and reengineering.
name: Cheryl McCoy, MBA
title: Managing Director, Interaction Strategy & Support at Charles Schwab
